page.title: 03Margam Country Park
page.content: Formerly the property of the Mansel Talbots, it was acquired by the County of West Glamorgan in 1973. The area contains the historic nucleus of a park of 840 acres. Sites include: an Iron Age Hill Fort, Margam Castle, Margam Orangery, the remains of a Cistercian Abbey, and outside the park the Abbey Church. The park has marked walks, picnic sites and extensive ornamental gardens. Also present is a sculpture park, a maze and adventure playground for children, putting, pony riding, fishing, Fantasy village and boating. The Coed Morgannwg Way, a long distance country walk, links the Park with Afan Argoed and Craig Y LLyn. Approximately 250,000 people visit the park annually though in 1985 numbers dropped sharply due to the wet summer.
